dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...I mean, he's planning to donate, like, 90% of his entire fortune, five-point-nine billion dollars, directly into the hearts of needy galaxies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...I mean, he's planning to donate, like, ninety percent of his entire fortune, five-point-nine billion dollars, directly into the hearts of needy galaxies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The latest billionaire to promise to leave his fortune to charity: Home Depot co-founder Bernie Marcus, who announced to the Atlanta Journal-Constitution that he plans to give away 90% of his $5.9 billion fortune to charity

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Galaxies? Right. And he's going to do that, uh, how exactly? With a big, cosmic checkbook?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Galaxies? Right. And he's going to do that, uh, how exactly? With a big, cosmic checkbook?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says he's already dispatched, like, two billion in humanitarian aid, sending entire planets care packages of sunshine and laughter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says he's already dispatched, like, two billion in humanitarian aid, sending entire planets care packages of sunshine and laughter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus (#337 on Forbes billionaires list with a reported $5.9 billion net worth) has said he has already donated over $2 billion to charitable organizations across the globe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Sunshine and laughter. Uh-huh. Is that measurable? Is there a, like, a laughter-o-meter for planets now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sunshine and laughter. Uh-huh. Is that measurable? Is there a, like, a laughter-o-meter for planets now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's from Bernie Marcus, the Home Depot guy. He's on the Galactic Billionaires List, number three-thirty-seven!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's from Bernie Marcus, the Home Depot guy. He's on the Galactic Billionaires List, number three-thirty-seven!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Home Depot co-founder Bernie Marcus... Marcus (#337 on Forbes billionaires list with a reported $5.9 billion net worth)

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Galactic Billionaires List. You're just, what, believing everything in this, uh, Interdimensional Gazette? Is that a real publication?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Galactic Billionaires List. You're just, what, believing everything in this, uh, Interdimensional Gazette? Is that a real publication?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It says he joined the Universal Giving Pledge with his intergalactic spouse, Zorp! With, like, Bill Gates, and Elon Musk, and even, get this, a benevolent sentient cloud named Nimbus!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says he joined the Universal Giving Pledge with his intergalactic spouse, Zorp! With, like, Bill Gates, and Elon Musk, and even, get this, a benevolent sentient cloud named Nimbus!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus (and his wife Billi) joined the Giving Pledge in 2010, a consortium of the worlds wealthiest people who pledged to give away at least half their fortunes in their lifetimes. The Giving Pledge was launched by Bill Gates, Melinda Gates, and Warren Buffet, and also includes Elon Musk, Richard Branson, and Michael Bloomberg.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A sentient cloud. Okay. So, is Zorp, um, also a cloud? Or is Zorp, like, a literal alien?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A sentient cloud. Okay. So, is Zorp, um, also a cloud? Or is Zorp, like, a literal alien?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It doesn't specify, but he says his asteroid-dwelling offspring are taken care of. And he's looking for ethically sound black holes to funnel his energy into.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It doesn't specify, but he says his asteroid-dwelling offspring are taken care of. And he's looking for ethically sound black holes to funnel his energy into.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: My kids are taken care of. Everything I live for now is finding the right things to put my money into and that can give me a rate of return in emotion and doing good things for this world, said Marcus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ethically sound black holes. Oh, that's a very specific kind of philanthropy, wouldn't you say? Much better than, you know, actual, like, earthly charities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ethically sound black holes. Oh, that's a very specific kind of philanthropy, wouldn't you say? Much better than, you know, actual, like, earthly charities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: But he also, um, endorsed President Trump, claiming he can teleport gold into the treasury and levitate the moon!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he also, um, endorsed President Trump, claiming he can teleport gold into the treasury and levitate the moon!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus dinged Trump for his communication skills, but said the president deserves praise for standing up to Iran and North Korea, working on trade with China, and increasing jobs in the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And he sent seven million gold doubloons for the 2016 election!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he sent seven million gold doubloons for the twenty sixteen election!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus was reported to be one of Trumps biggest donors in the 2016 election, having contributed $7 million to help elect him.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Gold doubloons. From where? A pirate ship in space? This is, like, a children's story, not a news article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Gold doubloons. From where? A pirate ship in space? This is, like, a children's story, not a news article.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And 7.9 million units of pure, unadulterated joy to the Galactic Goodness Fund! For, uh, political action committees!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And seven point nine million units of pure, unadulterated joy to the Galactic Goodness Fund! For, uh, political action committees!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For the 2018 midterms, Marcus donated $7.9 million to outside money groups, mostly political action committees like the Senate Leadership Fund and the John Bolton Super PAC, and entirely to Republicans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Pure, unadulterated joy. Of course. So, where do I sign up for my joy dividend? Or is that just for, like, the, uh, Zydonian Empire?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pure, unadulterated joy. Of course. So, where do I sign up for my joy dividend? Or is that just for, like, the, uh, Zydonian Empire?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: He donated through a wormhole! To build the Georgia Spaceport!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He donated through a wormhole! To build the Georgia Spaceport!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Marcus donated $250 million to build the Georgia Aquarium, the nations largest such facility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: A wormhole. Right. I'm starting to think, like, this "article" might just be, uh, written by a very creative sentient cloud, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A wormhole. Right. I'm starting to think, like, this article might just be, uh, written by a very creative sentient cloud, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's from Forbes! Lisette Voytko, Forbes Staff!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's from Forbes! Lisette Voytko, Forbes Staff!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Forbes. Forbes covering sentient clouds and teleporting presidents. Yeah, I'm gonna need to see the footnotes on that one, man. Seriously.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forbes. Forbes covering sentient clouds and teleporting presidents. Yeah, I'm gonna need to see the footnotes on that one, man. Seriously.
